news.title: Met Éireann issues high temperature warnings for 14 counties on Friday and whole country on Saturday, ahead of 30C mini-heatwave
news.summary: Met Éireann has issued a Status Yellow high temperature warning as Ireland is set for sweltering heat over the next four days as well as a mini-heatwave.

news.title: Top chef Dylan McGrath’s Fade Street Social owes Revenue €1.7m and cannot pay debts
news.summary: Chef Dylan McGrath’s Prime Steak Restaurant, which trades as Fade Street Social, owes Revenue €1.7m “and maybe more” and is unable to pay its debts, Judge John O’Connor has heard in the Circuit Civil Court.

news.title: ‘He was one of a kind’ – Donegal father who died after being hit by car in California remembered as ‘an extraordinary man’
news.summary: A Donegal father who died after being struck by a car in California has been remembered as an “extraordinary man”.

news.title: Pensioner Tom Niland suffered injuries similar to ‘head-on crash’ during break-in, witness to tell trial
news.summary: A pensioner sustained injuries during an alleged break-in at his rural Sligo home that were similar to those from a "head-on crash", a witness will tell a Central Criminal Court jury.

news.title: Dónal Lynch: Growing tired of And Just Like That? Rewind instead to the greatest TV series of all time – Girls
news.summary: W e hit peak  And Just Like That  hatred this week, with the accusation that the writers have simply recycled a storyline from an earlier season. Not even a good storyline: one of the pointless new characters’ fathers was killed off sometime earlier.

news.title: ‘It’s unbelievable. It’s what I fought for’ – Brilliant Ben Healy secures Ireland’s first Tour de France stage victory in five years
news.summary: A fantastic day for Ireland on the Tour de France today saw Ben Healy take his first-ever Tour stage victory while compatriot Eddie Dunbar took his highest stage placing when he finished fourth on stage six in Normandy.

news.title: Declan Lynch: ‘This was the worst “take” in all of human history, so it’s no harm to hear it refuted by a Joe O’Connor’
news.summary: Last week I was pointing out that the best thing on the radio these days is  Culture File: The Comfort Zone  on Lyric FM, presented by Luke Clancy. I mentioned in particular the contributions of writer Colm Tóibín.

news.title: Babysitting uncle livestreamed abuse of his sleeping nephew
news.summary: A "trusted" uncle was babysitting when he livestreamed a web chat to a random man online as he sexually assaulted his sleeping 12-year-old nephew, a court has heard.

news.title: ‘I’m not whingeing, but I’m looking forward to a week of normality’ – Andy Farrell on gruelling tour schedule
news.summary: Andy Farrell says he is loving the relentless nature of this Lions tour but admitted he is looking forward to next week when the squad are based in one city and preparing for their first Test against Australia.

news.title: Private school principal shredded work diaries during probe into ‘rival’ grinds business
news.summary: The ex-principal of the fee-paying Leinster Senior College has lost a challenge to his sacking after he shredded work diaries when his employer put him under investigation for running a “rival” grinds business.
